title: Lear's hauberk
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                     |
| - | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A well-made golden hauberk that covers all of its wearer's body parts. It includes a chainmail coif, chausses and maille gauntlets. |

[![Lear's hauberk.png](/images/7/7c/Lear%27s_hauberk.png)](/File:Lear%27s_hauberk.png) ***the +18 Lear's hauberk***

+18 [chain mail](/Chain_mail "Chain mail")

Fills your body, head, gloves, and feet armour slots

## Desirability

**Lear's hauberk**[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) is an unusual piece of equipment, a heavily enchanted [chain mail](/Chain_mail "Chain mail") that fills 4 equipment slots. To wear it, you must be able to wear chain mail, [hats](/Hat "Hat"), [boots](/Boots "Boots"), and [gloves](/Gloves "Gloves"). Therefore, many species ([Trolls](/Troll "Troll"), [Ogres](/Ogre "Ogre"), [Spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan"), [Armataurs](/Armataur "Armataur"), [Djinn](/Djinn "Djinn"), [Formicids](/Formicid "Formicid"), [Nagas](/Naga "Naga"), and [Tengu](/Tengu "Tengu")) are unable to wear it, [Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk") will meld it when in/above [water](/Water "Water"). and certain level 3 [mutations](/Mutation "Mutation") will block it.

In practice, Lear's hauberk is less spectacular than it seems. If you already have a +2 [helmet](/Helmet "Helmet"), [gloves](/Gloves "Gloves"), and [boots](/Boots "Boots"), Lear's hauberk is equivalent to a +9 chain mail. However, a +9 chain mail is still a decent choice for melee brutes, and the hauberk has a few other advantages:

- You'll often find it before getting any sort of headgear/gloves/boots. Getting a +18 chain mail is a *massive* boost to defense, especially in the early game.
- Lear's hauberk saves [scrolls of enchant armour](/Scrolls_of_enchant_armour "Scrolls of enchant armour"), which can be used on a [shield](/Shield "Shield") or other pieces of equipment. A +9 [plate armour](/Plate_armour "Plate armour") might give more AC than the hauberk, but having a +9 chain mail and +8 [tower shield](/Tower_shield "Tower shield") is much better for defense.

The main downside is that the hauberk takes up 3 extra equipment slots; wearing it means losing any [egos](/Ego "Ego") or [artefact](/Artefact "Artefact") properties from the head, hand, and foot slots. As you find good equipment in those slots, you may value the resistances or other intrinsics over a plain, +9 chain mail. So you'll often want to switch to a different body armour eventually (depending on what you find, of course).

This artefact is more likely to spawn in the early game, where it is more likely to be useful.

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Lear's hauberk was +[27](/27 "27"), and its generation was not favored for the early-game.
- Lear's hauberk was added in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), replacing [Lear's chain mail](/Lear%27s_chain_mail "Lear's chain mail").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [art-data.txt:897](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.1/crawl-ref/source/art-data.txt#L897) (0.30.1)

+18 chain mail

Desirability

Lear's hauberk[1] is an unusual piece of equipment, a heavily enchanted chain mail that fills 4 equipment slots. To wear it, you must be able to wear chain mail, hats, boots, and gloves. Therefore, many species (Trolls, Ogres, Spriggans, Armataurs, Djinn, Formicids, Nagas, and Tengu) are unable to wear it, Merfolk will meld it when in/above water. and certain level 3 mutations will block it.

In practice, Lear's hauberk is less spectacular than it seems. If you already have a +2 helmet, gloves, and boots, Lear's hauberk is equivalent to a +9 chain mail. However, a +9 chain mail is still a decent choice for melee brutes, and the hauberk has a few other advantages:

  • You'll often find it before getting any sort of headgear/gloves/boots. Getting a +18 chain mail is a massive boost to defense, especially in the early game.
  • Lear's hauberk saves scrolls of enchant armour, which can be used on a shield or other pieces of equipment. A +9 plate armour might give more AC than the hauberk, but having a +9 chain mail and +8 tower shield is much better for defense.

The main downside is that the hauberk takes up 3 extra equipment slots; wearing it means losing any egos or artefact properties from the head, hand, and foot slots. As you find good equipment in those slots, you may value the resistances or other intrinsics over a plain, +9 chain mail. So you'll often want to switch to a different body armour eventually (depending on what you find, of course).

This artefact is more likely to spawn in the early game, where it is more likely to be useful.

History

  • Prior to 0.28, Lear's hauberk was +27, and its generation was not favored for the early-game.
  • Lear's hauberk was added in 0.13, replacing Lear's chain mail.
